definition: to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
elderly man/father/father-in-law/neck feathers of a bird (old)

sentences.english: Grandpa left, yet the roly-poly left me.
sentences.chinese: 爺爺走了，卻把不倒翁留給了我。

sentences.english: My personal image of resilience is a large blow-up figure weighted at the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 我對彈性的個人圖像是一個不倒翁。

sentences.english: Roly-poly character, perhaps innate stubbornness about me?
sentences.chinese: 不倒翁的性格，這也許跟我天生的固執有關？

sentences.english: First open your front door and check for a pin tumbler lock on it.
sentences.chinese: 首先打開你的大門，並檢查了不倒翁密碼鎖。

sentences.english: A "daruma" although won't fall, but also so not meeting the further.
sentences.chinese: 不倒翁雖然不會摔倒，但也因此不會前進一步。

sentences.english: In that case, we'll have to correctly position the bottom tumbler first.
sentences.chinese: 在這種情況下，我們必須要正確定位底部不倒翁第一。

sentences.english: A roly-poly toy, tilting doll, tumbler or wobbly man is a toy that rights itself when pushed over.
sentences.chinese: 不倒翁，就是每次被壓倒都會自己站起來的玩具。

sentences.english: I bought a roly? poly of the God of Longevity at that stall.
sentences.chinese: 我在那個攤頭買了個壽星不倒翁。

definition: to fall headlong/(fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure
a drum-shaped rattle (used by peddlers or as a toy)/rattle-drum
see-saw/also written 蹺蹺板|跷跷板[qiao1 qiao1 ban3]
